data.title: Good cheesecake!
data.text: Cheesecakes by James were on display at an event at the Jacob Henry mansion in Joliet honoring Big Brothers Big Sisters. From the few small samples I tried they were very creamy and delicious. There was a chocolate one that was stellar. I'd love to try more! Have never been inside his store yet or anything but I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to people in the area.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: If your in the downtown Joliet area having lunch or dinner, hold off on the restaurant dessert....walk down to cheesecakes by James you will not be disappointed!! You will be greeted by an enthusiastic owner named James! He is so great and lives to tell you his story of making cheesecakes from his grandmothers recipes. There are so many to choose from the triple chocolate is decadent! The original with strawberries is just like a homemade treat! Oreo cheesecake was creamy and crunchy all in one!! You can buy a whole cheesecake or just a piece!! But James is a treat in himself- love love!!

data.title: Cheesecake Heaven
data.text: James is wonderful! He has the best cheesecake I have ever eaten. He goes above and beyond to make sure that his cheesecake is the best!  Don't even bother with Eli's or Cheesecake factory they are mass produced and cheap tasting. Not James, large and fresh.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Cheesecake by James is excellent cheesecake. Quite possibly the best cheesecake.  Not just in Joliet.  Anywhere!   I only eat the plain one with raspberry sauce because I prefer my cheesecake without "stuff"  in it but he has a lot of options for those who enjoy their cheesecake loaded.

data.title: Great guy!
data.text: We were just driving around Joliet when we ran across this cute little store that sells cheesecakes. We went inside and we're greeted by the very nice guy who was the owner James. He is very friendly and we enjoyed the cheesecakes. Try it out, if only to meet a really great enteprenuer.

data.title: Cheesecake Heaven
data.text: I've had cheesecake and then I had cheesecake by James.  Simply the best and James is a dedicated young man. They make fantastic gifts and parking is easy.

data.title: Hidden Gem Under the Neon
data.text:
This place is off Chicago Street, on Cass.  It has a nice neon sign - so pay attention and try it out.

We wanted to stop in, but the local businesses in the Joliet downtown area close at 6:00 pm, so we have missed trying this place out.  Tonight, we got an early start, and we finally got there and tried it out.

Good cheesecake.  Really Good cheesecake!

James (of Cheesecakes by James) actually works here as the manager and the cook.  To say he is invested in this place would be an understatement - he seems to live for his cooking.  

You could taste that in his cheesecakes.  We both went with the Raspberry, and I could taste the real raspberry in the cheesecake.

The prices range from $4 for a slice of plain, up to $6.25 for a slice of Triple Chocaolate.  24 hour notice is requested for whole cakes, with 8 and 10 inch versions available for most of his 9 flavors.

I'm glad we stopped - we'll be back.  Give this place a try - get to Tin Roof, Juliets, Chicken N Spice, or Chicago Pub and Grill, and take a side trip down Cass.  Get there before 6 pm, and get an excellent slice of dessert!  Better yet, buy a slice of each, and post your own review.  I should have done that.
